issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Discovered by [~dkavanagh]. After some periods of high traffics, servo daemon crashes and no more changes to the loadbalancer is effective.The issue is reproducible.

comments.body:
System log says the process was killed due to out of memory. 
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [ pid ]   uid  tgid total_vm      rss cpu oom_adj oom_score_adj name
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [  332]     0   332     2669      110   0     -17         -1000 udevd
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [  804]     0   804     2280      121   0       0             0 dhclient
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [  855]     0   855     6899       66   0     -17         -1000 auditd
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [  875]     0   875    62289      141   0       0             0 rsyslogd
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [ 1034]     0  1034    16554      177   0     -17         -1000 sshd
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [ 1090]   501  1090   163749    49825   0       0             0 load-balancer-s
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: [ 1094]     0  1094     2668      110   0     -17         -1000 udevd

Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: Out of memory: Kill process 1090 (load-balancer-s) score 818 or sacrifice child
Aug 25 19:32:01 euca-10-111-76-196 kernel: Killed process 1090, UID 501, (load-balancer-s) total-vm:654996kB, anon-rss:199284kB, file-rss:16kB

To test, create a LB with access log enabled with emit interval = 60 min. Try generating large web traffics to ELB (like doing curl in loops) for at least 1 hour. Then make sure still the daemon is running (for example by looking cloud-watch metrics or backend instances remain in InService).
